item.description:
Sunflower and pea shoots cost a mint at grocery stores, but are cheap to grow at home. Sprouted lentils and buckwheat are healthy, but how do you eat them? In this two-session series, the facilitators, nine-year adherents to a raw-food diet, will show you how to grow sprouts and microgreens using a variety of methods, and then offer hands-on experience preparing tasty dishes with these enzyme-rich, vitamin-packed foods. Recipes include collard green roll-ups with sprouted mung bean pate, clover sprouts and pea tendrils; sprouted buckwheat tabouli; raw hummus; and spicy sprouted lentils. For more info before you register, call CCAE for the instructors' contact info. NOTE: in order to enroll in section 02 (recipe prep), you must also take section 01 (sprouting demonstration). You may, however, take section 01 without taking section 02. Section 01 limited to 30; section 02 limited to 16.
SPROUTING DEMO Sec. 01: 1 Thursday, 5:30-8:00 pm. Jun. 16, 56 Brattle St. | $25 *NOTE: change from print catalog description and tuiton*
SPTS–01
$25.00

http://www.ccae.org/catalog/detail.php?id=5...
item.how_to_find_us: Register at CAmbridge Center, call 617-492-2340 for info
item.name: Sprouting Class at Cambridge Center for Adult Education
